entry.title: How to migrate Rentable Object w/o Portfolio Structure (RW) in SAP Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

There is migration object to migrate real estate usable object. May i know what is the migration object to migrate real estate Rentable Object w/o Portfolio Structure (RW)?

 

Thanks.

entry.title: Questions regarding Business Partner Migration via Migration Cockpit in SAP Public Cloud（ID:F3473）
entry.content:
Hi,

I am attempting to migrate Business Partner (BP) master data using the SAP S/4HANA Cloud Migration Cockpit（ID:F3473）.

I understand that the key fields are "Customer Code" and "BP Grouping." However, I would like to know if it's possible to use a BP Grouping other than the standard ones.

I believe the standard groupings are as follows:
BP01
BP02
BP03
BPAB
CPDA
CPDN
CPDS

When I try to perform the migration using a BP Grouping that I created in addition to these, I receive the following error message:
"Assignment of BP grouping XXXX to customer account group is not possible" (Message Class: CNV_DMC_SIN, Message No.: 587)

Is there any specific setting that needs to be configured to resolve the cause of this error?

Any guidance would be greatly appreciated.

entry.title: Workflows Migration.
entry.content:
Dear experts,

I'm looking for a guide, conversion objects matrix, or documentation on migrating workflows from an on-premise system to S/4 HANA. Keeping in mind that the target system only allows user access through SAP Fiori, I'm considering that.
That is, if a step in my workflow calls a transaction, what should I look for? A Fiori app if it's standard, or a Fiori development if it's a client transaction (z).
If a workflow step calls a classic SAP Fiori app, what should I do? Create a Fiori app?
How can i find this recomendations?

Thank you very much and best regards.
Dsanchez.

entry.title: ODN Official Document Numbering fields in Migration Cockpit templates
entry.content:
Hi

I have configured and tested ODN field, following blog: https://community.sap.com/t5/enterprise-resource-planning-blog-posts-by-sap/how-to-store-long-suppli...

It is working fine.

How can we migrate those values from the old system during open item migration? AP migration will include open invoices that should be complete, with long invoice number. AR invoices should be migrated with e-document number that is also stored in ODN field, as per standard system configuration. As far as I checked, the migration template does not include that fields, even when ODN field is configured in the system. 

What should be done to migrate the values of ODN fields as part of AP/AR open items migration?

BR

Małgorzata

entry.title: Enabling Multiple Instances (Bulk) processing on a custom Migration Object
entry.content:
Hi,

I have created a custom Migration Object in txn LTMOM (using the Staging Tables approach) and selected the "Process Multiple Instances at Once" checkbox for my object.  Looking at standard templates with this enabled, I can see that the input tables contain a field called SENDER_TECHNICAL_ID (data element FS4MIG_SENDER_TECHNICAL_ID) and the return table also has a special type (table type FS4MIG_T_BAPIRET2) which also contains this field.  So far, so good!

I have looked at the code in "Includes for Handling the Result Parameter" of standard bulk-enabled templates and they share some common processing, particularly the use of standard include DMC_PLV_OLO_BULK.  Following these examples, I have written my own include for my object which also has DMC_PLV_OLO_BULK included at the end.

The problem comes when I try to generate my object.  I get the error message:
FORM "_RULE_IS_S4H_CLOUD_P" does not exist.
Further investigation shows that this subroutine is called from the standard DMC_PLV_OLO_BULK include.

Looking at the function groups that have been generated for objects from standard templates, I can see that this subroutine, along with many others, can be found in the ...FI4 include (named "IL - RULE CODE").  Although a ...FI4 include appears in the function group generated from my custom object, it does not contain any of the subroutines that are called from the standard DMC_PLV_OLO_BULK include.  I have compared the set up of my custom object with some of the standard objects but I can't find any setting or code that would lead to these additional subroutines being put in the ...FI4 include.

Does anyone know what triggers these standard subroutines being included in the generated function group?  Has anyone managed to bulk-enable a custom migration object using  the common includes found in the standard objects?

Many thanks in advance,

Andrew

entry.title: Clarification on “Manage Memo Record 2.0” and Bank Account Opening Balance Behavior
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

According to the SAP Help Portal, the “FI – Bank Account Balance (Deprecated)” template has been deprecated, and SAP now recommends using the “Manage Memo Record 2.0” app to import the initial bank account balance.

Ref : FI - Bank account balance (deprecated) | SAP Help Portal

I have tried entering the bank accoount balance using the Manage Memo Record 2.0 app.
After the upload, the amount correctly appears in the Cash Flow Analyzer app for the respective bank account, which indicates the memo record is recognized by the system.

However, when I subsequently created the first bank statement in the system, the amount entered via Manage Memo Record 2.0 does not appear as the opening balance for that bank account in the statement.

Could anyone please clarify:

  1. Why the amount recorded via Manage Memo Record 2.0 is not reflected as the opening balance in the first bank statement?

Thank you very much for your guidance and support.

entry.title: Migration Cockpit Material BOM Item ID control field ITM_IDENT_EXT issue
entry.content:
Experts, need help with S4 Hana 2023/08 Migration Cockpit (MC) loading the Material BOM.  In the download Template there is a field on the BOM Item called "Item ID".  This is a mandatory field, but we want the system to generate the Item ID number and not have to enter in one for every BOM item we have.

From the information on the internet, the control field ITM_IDENT_EXT field needs to contain a 'X' for the system to generate this field during conversion.  It is supposed to be located on the MC Template for the Material BOM in the BOM Item section.  But this field does not exist.

We reviewed the information for the MC Project in the LTMOM transaction and could not find this ITM_IDENT_EXT field anywhere.  If we try to leave the "Item ID" field on the template blank, we get an error during the MC Upload.

Does anyone know where this ITM_IDENT_EXT field exist or how to force  the MC to automatically generate the "Item ID" field during conversion?

Any help would be appreciated.

entry.title: How to migrate service purchase order data by migration cockpit
entry.content:
Hi Dears
I am doing some migration work of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 
I want to migrate service purchase order whose acct assignment category is R (service order) by the migration cockpit.
But there is no service document option in the template. There is sales order, sales item and so on.

Is there any way to migrate service purchase order by migration cockpit?

I have got advice below

>The SAP Clean-Core approach recommends the following options:

  • Option A is to create Purchase Order Automatically from Service Orders (recommended by SAP)
  • Option B is to manually create post-migration: this is if you really need to migrate legacy POs for reporting.
  • Option C suggest a technical migration, where you use the side-by-side API approach. This should be considered if you need to preserve bulk historical data.
    But I have not solved my problem. 

# Data Migration Cockpit
# SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 
# Service Purchase Order

entry.title: Import bulk of custom fields in Data Migration modeler (LTMOM) using Upload Structure Field List
entry.content:
Challenge: When migrating complex master data like Business Partner - General Data (BP) to S/4HANA, you often receive requirements for over a hundred custom Z-fields sourced from a legacy system like CRM. Manually adding these fields one-by-one in the #LTMOM (Migration Object Modeler) is incredibly time-consuming and prone to errors.

Solution: Leverage the Upload Structure Field List option within LTMOM, as this feature allows you to bulk import field definitions using a simple text file, and it drastically reduce development time as well.

Summary of Step-by-Step Guide: Uploading Custom Z-Fields

Example with BP General data Z-Fields:
The following steps focuses on creating a new, user-defined migration object to handle the custom fields for the BP General Data (BUT000 table), using Function Module as the target.

How to create the Custom Migration Object
Execute transaction code LTMOM (Migration Object Modeler).

Select and Open the Project which was created in LTMC already.

In the menu bar, navigate to Project → Create Migration Object → User-Defined → Migrate Data Using Files/Staging Tables.


Enter the required Object ID and the description. Then choose the Function Module as the Target Structure option, then click Next.


Prepare the Source Structure File
Before creating the source structure, you must prepare the text file containing the field definitions.

  • File Format: Use a Text File with a Semicolon (;) delimiter. (Note: Standard comma-separated values (CSV) often fail with a pop-up error, even if the data is clean.)
  • Data Structure (Meta Format): The file needs to adhere to a specific structure for each Z-Field:
    Key FieldNameData TypeLengthDecimal PlacesAmount FieldLong Field LabelGroup TextCheck TableTooltipCustom Field

 






Create and Upload the Source Structure
In the LTMOM sidebar, double-click on Source Structure.

Right-click on the right sidebar and choose Append Structure to Lower Level. Enter the desired      name for your source structure (e.g., ZS_BP_CUSTOM).
Click the Upload Structure Field List option.

Browse and select your semicolon-delimited text file. The system will now generate all 100+ fields automatically.

Save changes and successfully created source structure using upload file.

Conclusion: Efficiency Through Correct Delimiter
As you can see the step-by-step guidance, by utilizing the Upload Structure Field List along with the semicolon-delimited text file, the development time can be significantly reduced. This approach streamlines the addition of high volume of custom fields in the existing Function Modules with maximum efficiency and minimal manual effort.

entry.title: SAP TRM Migration to Public Cloud – Cash Flow Transaction/Facility Object Missing?
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

I’m currently working on a migration project involving SAP TRM (Treasury and Risk Management) in the public cloud, and I’m looking for insights from anyone who has experience with this.

From the migration object list, I noticed that Interest Rate Instrument (IRI) and Letter of Credit (LoC) are included, which is great. However, I couldn’t find any mention of Cash Flow Transaction/Facility as a migration object.

Before I proceed further, I wanted to ask:

  • Has anyone here have an experience in migrating TRM objects to the public cloud?
  • Specifically, did you encounter the same issue with Cash Flow Transaction/Facility not being listed?
  • If this object is indeed not supported in the standard migration cockpit, did you end up using LSMW or another workaround?
  • Any lessons learned or recommendations would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks in advance!

entry.content: During migration of Fixed assets in Simulation Phase I am facing error- "Dep. start date required in old asset".

entry.title: Best approach to migrate 1M Customers & Vendors from ECC to BP in S/4HANA – DMC vs CVI?
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

We are preparing a migration from SAP ECC to SAP S/4HANA and we have approx. 1 million customer and vendor records that must be converted to Business Partners (BP).

We are evaluating the best migration approach and would like input from the community:

Has anyone successfully migrated a very large volume of customers and vendors directly via Data Migration Cockpit (DMC)?

Has anyone enabled CVI (Customer Vendor Integration) in ECC first, converted the master data there, and then migrated only balances / open items to S/4HANA?

For high volumes (1M+ business partners), what is the recommended best practice according to your experience?

Key questions we are trying to answer:

Is it more stable to activate CVI in ECC and synchronize customers/vendors to BP before the migration?

Does DMC scale efficiently for this volume of business partner creation?

Any lessons learned, performance considerations, or pitfalls to avoid?

Any guidance, experience sharing, or official SAP recommendations would be highly appreciated.

Thank you!

entry.title: How to migrate data from S4HANA Cloud Private to S4HANA Cloud Public?
entry.content:
According to the guide SAP S/4HANA Migration Cockpit SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition,
The SAP S/4HANA Migration Cockpit, is Not designed for:

"Migrating data directly from SAP S/4HANA system to other SAP S/4HANA systems independent of deployment option is currently not supported"

Therefore, what alternatives do we have if a client is in S4HANA Cloud Private and wants to migrate their data to a new S4HANA Cloud Public system? This isn't a greenfield deployment, but rather a conversion. Is there a plan to provide an SAP application that can facilitate this type of migration?

I would appreciate any suggestions or links that might help.
